definition: shortcut
Czech/Czech Republic/abbr. for 捷克[Jie2 ke4]
variant of 捷[jie2]/quick/nimble
victory/triumph/quick/nimble/prompt
footpath/track/diameter/straight/directly
lit. Mt Zhongnan is a shortcut to a ministerial job (idiom); fig. to take a shortcut to promotion

sentences.english: It is a shortcut to accomplishment and an easy escape from embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 它是走向成功的捷径，也是摆脱困境的妙方。

sentences.english: Thee comic is an ironical illustration that it is unadvisable to search for a shortcut to learning.
sentences.chinese: 漫画是一种讽刺的说明，这是不可取的寻找学习捷径。

sentences.english: Becoming a doctor requires years of training there are really no short cuts.
sentences.chinese: 当医生需要多年的学习和锻炼实无捷径可言。

sentences.english: Shortcut menus are usually available by right-clicking the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 捷径功能表通常都可以按一下滑鼠右键取得。

sentences.english: Since the example application is a blog, you get to take a shortcut.
sentences.chinese: 因示例应用程序是一个博客，我们可以走个捷径。

sentences.english: They took a shortcut to go on shore.
A shortcut route has been provided for working out the post-process program of parallel-link machine tools.
sentences.chinese: 为编制虚拟轴机床数控后处理程序提供一条捷径。

sentences.english: Lotteries are being billed as a way to get wealth without saving and investing.
sentences.chinese: 彩票被描绘成不用投资和存钱就可以发财的捷径。

sentences.english: Every road felt like a shortcut.
sentences.chinese: 每一条道路都象是一条捷径。

sentences.english: Learn from the experience of others, it is less costly mistakes fastest shortcut.
sentences.chinese: 学习他人的经验，是少走冤枉路的最快捷径。

sentences.english: The short cut ia steep and more difficult to climb. Only the brave few took the path.
sentences.chinese: 那条捷径很陡，十分难爬，只有少数勇敢者走这条路。

sentences.english: The F9 Menu also provides a shortcut to toggle full-screen mode.
sentences.chinese: F9菜单同样提供一个捷径去固定满屏模式。

sentences.english: Is there any short-cut, I wonder?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道有什么捷径吗？

sentences.english: Often, those shortcuts have relied on the assistance of doctors.
sentences.chinese: 通常情况下，找到这些捷径依赖于医生的帮忙。

sentences.english: Thus, war, for the officials, was always the swiftest and straightest road to riches.
sentences.chinese: 因此，战争永远是地方官发财的捷径。

sentences.english: There's are short-cuts of happiness, and dancing is one of them.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈是其中一条通往快乐的捷径。

definition: lit. Mt Zhongnan is a shortcut to a ministerial job (idiom); fig. to take a shortcut to promotion
a way out (lit. and fig.)/opportunity for advancement/a way forward/outlet (for one's products)
the one and only way/the only proper course to take
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
method/way/approach
all roads lead to Rome/use different means to obtain the same result (idiom)
pinyin: tiao2 tiao2 da4 lu4 tong1 Luo2 ma3

definition: winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
the road one must follow or take/the only way/same as 必由之路[bi4 you2 zhi1 lu4]
reaching heaven in a single bound (idiom); (esp. with negative: don't expect) instant success
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
to take an indirect route/to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method
secret/trick/knack/key
highway/level road
quick fix/opportune short cut (around a difficulty)/cheap trick (to get what one wants)/to pull a fast one
crash (course)/accelerated (process)/quick (fix)/instant (success)/to achieve in a short time
